Professional Ethics.question: One of the following is not a necessary condition to be fulfilled by aspirants to the Nigerian Bar

options.a: Success at Law School Portfolio Assessment
options.d: Success at Bar Part II Examinations

Professional Ethics.reason: Decree No.9 of 1922 allows for non-Nigerians to be called to the Nigerian Bar

Professional Ethics.question: All of the following are incorrect about the processing fee required of applicants for the rank of Senior Advocate of Nigeria except:
Professional Ethics.reason: Every Applicant for the rank of SAN shall pay a non-refundable processing fee in the sum of ₦1,000,000 or such amount as may be fixed by the LPPC. Section 9(3) of the Guidelines for the Conferment of the Rank of SAN 2018 (It has been amended).

Professional Ethics.question: A lawyer who is in active legal practice is prohibited from being:

options.a: The Managing Director of a company
options.d: A non-executive director of a company

Professional Ethics.answer: The Managing Director of a company
Professional Ethics.reason: Managing Director of a company is an executive officer of the company, but the Chairman is a non- executive officer. Rule 7(3), RPC

Professional Ethics.question: To enjoy the exclusive rights of legal practitioners in Nigeria, a lawyer must have to do all the following except

options.b: The appropriate use of seal and stamp
options.c: Participating in mandatory continuing legal education
options.d: Contesting for executive positions of the NBA

Professional Ethics.answer: Contesting for executive positions of the NBA
Professional Ethics.reason: Rule 10 makes stamp and seal compulsory, Rule 9 does the same for practising fee and Rule 11 does the same for mandatory continuing legal education, prescribing hours expected of lawyers

Professional Ethics.question: Tony, a 10 year old girl, was raped by two thugs on her way home from school. She was brutally injured and left to die, but was miraculously rushed to the Hospital by passers-by and she survived. Furious and determined to end the lives of the two thugs, Carlee Jackson, the father of Tony, contacted Jimoh Esq and told him of his intention to kill the thugs and should be be charged to court, Jimoh would defend him. Jimoh advised him to go ahead saying if he found himself in similar situation, he would have killed the thugs a long time ago. Which professional duty has Jimoh Esq breached from the scenario?

options.a: Duty to advise his client within the bounds of the law
options.b: Duly to prevent the commission of a crime
options.c: Duty to uphold the rule of law

Professional Ethics.reason: See Rule 1 and 15 of the RPC 2023

Professional Ethics.question: A counsel does not owe any duty to the
Professional Ethics.reason: Rules 14 - 25 provides for duties to client, Rules 26 - 29 provides for duties to other lawyers, Rules 30 - 38 provides for duties to the court

Professional Ethics.question: What does the Rule 39 provides for?

options.a: Dedication and devotion to the cause of the client

Professional Ethics.reason: A lawyer can advertise to an extent but cannot solicit.

Professional Ethics.question: All except one are members of the National Judicial Council

options.c: Next most senior Justice of the Supreme Court
options.d: President of the Court of Appeal

Professional Ethics.reason: The AGF is not a member of the NJC. See the composition of the NJC, Third Schedule, CFRN

Professional Ethics.question: The total membership of the National Judicial Council according to the Constitution is
Professional Ethics.reason: See Third Schedule, CFRN as amended.

Professional Ethics.question: The Legal Practitioners Disciplinary Committee has decided to try Franklin for the professional offence(s) committed. Which of the following constitutes proper parties before the Committee?

options.d: Registered Trustees of NBA v Franklin

Professional Ethics.answer: Registered Trustees of NBA v Franklin
Professional Ethics.reason: See section 11 of the Legal Practitioners Act 1975

Professional Ethics.question: The Legal Practitioners Disciplinary Committee Rules was made by

options.a: The Attorney General of the Federation
options.b: The President of the Court of Appeal

Professional Ethics.reason: Section 10(7) LPA.

Professional Ethics.question: The standard of proof in contempt in facie curiae is

options.c: Proof to the satisfaction of the Court

Professional Ethics.reason: Proof of contempt, whether civil or criminal, is beyond reasonable doubt. This is because the outcome of contempt is penal in nature.

Professional Ethics.question: In legal drafting, how many types of paragraphing techniques do we have?
Professional Ethics.reason: There are two paragraphing techniques: two layered paragraph and three layered paragraph

Professional Ethics.question: You were an extern in the Legal Drafting Department of the Ministry of Justice of Lagos State. The Director has asked you what part of a legislation broadly captures main themes of the legislation?
Professional Ethics.reason: The Long title captures the main theme of the legislation

Professional Ethics.question: The doctrine of construing documents e.g. contracts that are ambiguous against the maker is termed
Professional Ethics.reason: The contra proferentem rule means that the words of a written document, usually an exclusion clause in a contract, are construed more forcibly against the party using them.

Professional Ethics.question: The rule relating to ordering witnesses out of court and hearing does not apply to:
Professional Ethics.reason: sec. 212 of Evidence Act

Professional Ethics.question: The statutory period for keeping closed files is
Professional Ethics.reason: There is no statutory period or limit within which closed files are to be kept.

Professional Ethics.question: The following are ethical issues in client interview and counselling except:

options.a: Advising the client within the bound of the law
options.c: Assuring the client of the success of his claim

Professional Ethics.answer: Assuring the client of the success of his claim
Professional Ethics.reason: You can't assure the client of success but you can brief him of the relative strengths and weaknesses of the case

Professional Ethics.question: A lawyer is allowed to make reasonable and permissible advertisements on all but one of the following
Professional Ethics.reason: see Rule 39 RPC 2023

Professional Ethics.question: Which of the following ADR mechanisms is regulated by the law?
Professional Ethics.reason: Arbitration and Conciliation Act
